description: How do film, literature, and the law in France address the trauma of World War II and its
aftermaths?  What are the "memory wars" and how are they represented and negotiated?  In this
course, students read short theoretical texts on memory and trauma studies and think about how
theories of memory and forgetting intersect on page and screen, as well as in policy and public
opinion.  Students respond to novels and films and analyze historical flashpoints and cultural
interpretations over time.  Taught in English.
Offered periodically.  May count toward the French major (see instructor).  Prerequisite: WRIT
fullname: Memory Wars: Remembering and Forgetting in Post-World War II France
